name: compound
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: compound
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a chemical that combines two or more elements

example.eg: Salt is a compound of sodium and chlorine.

example.egtrans: 许多化学肥料都含有氮化合物。

trans_examp.trans_en: something consisting of two or more different parts

example.eg: Then there was his manner, a curious compound of humour and severity.
example.egtrans: 还有他的态度，那是一种幽默与严厉的奇异混合。

trans_examp.trans_en: a word that combines two or more different words. Often, the meaning of the compound cannot be discovered by knowing the meaning of the different words that form it. Compounds may be written either as one word or as separate words

example.eg: 'Bodyguard' and 'floppy disk' are two examples of compounds.
example.egtrans: bodyguard 和 floppy disk 是两个复合词。

dsense.name: compound
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an area surrounded by fences or walls that contains a group of buildings

example.eg: The gates opened and the troops marched into their compound.
example.egtrans: 大门开了，部队进入他们的大院。

example.eg: The embassy compound has been closed to the public because of a bomb threat.
example.egtrans: 因受到炸弹威胁，使馆区停止对公众开放。

name: compound
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: compound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a problem or difficult situation worse

example.eg: Her terror was compounded by the feeling that she was being watched.
example.egtrans: 她有种被人监视的感觉，这加剧了她的恐惧感。

example.eg: His financial problems were compounded when he unexpectedly lost his job.
example.egtrans: 他意外地失去了工作，这使他手头更紧了。

example.eg: Severe drought has compounded food shortages in the region.
example.egtrans: 严重的干旱加剧了该地区的食品短缺问题。

dsense.name: compound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

example.eg: Most tyres are made of rubber compounded with other chemicals and materials.
example.egtrans: 大多数轮胎都是用橡胶和其他化学制品、材料混合制成的。

name: compound
posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: consisting of two or more parts

used to refer to a system of paying interest in which interest is paid both on the original amount of money invested (= given to companies hoping to get more back) or borrowed and on the interest that has collected over a period of time

example.eg: The investment fund has achieved annual compound returns of 18.2 percent.
example.egtrans: 投资得到了18.2%的复利年回报率。
